SENT.plain: Chest radiographs of invasive pulmonary aspergillosis in immunocompromised patients typically show ill-defined pulmonary nodules
Direct tracheal involvement has not been previously documented radiologically

Radiographs and CT scans of a 16-year-old boy with aplastic anemia and invasive pulmonary aspergillosis showed increased paratracheal opacity, tracheal narrowing, and pneumomediastinum in combination with pulmonary disease
Bronchial lavage cultures grew Aspergillus fumigatus, and the boy died 24 days later
